page.title: 16SCHOOLS IN HUMBERSTON
page.content: There are both Primary and Secondary Schools in the village. There is a Church of England Primary School,a County Infants School,a County Junior School and an 11 to 16 Comprehensive School. All the schools have suffered from the falling birth rate of the past ten years. The falling rolls have brought problems to the schools. Surplus staff have been compulsorily or voluntarily redeployed to other schools, leaving smaller numbers of teachers responsible for the wide modern curriculum. Local support for the schools is strong. As rolls fall, the future of the schools is uncertain. Within the next five years some schools within Humberside Education Authority face closure. Action groups formed by parents and governors are fighting to retain Humberston's facilities.
